newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: CRICKET-INDIA TO RESUME VICTORY BID AFTER RAIN.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-INDIA TO RESUME VICTORY BID AFTER RAIN.

text.p: India have 45.3 overs to take South Africa's remaining five wickets to win the third and final test after a thunderstorm interrupted play on Monday.
Play is to resume on the fifth and final day with South Africa reeling at 76 for five in pursuit of a victory target of 356.
The storm forced the players off half an hour before lunch and prevented a resumption before the scheduled tea interval.
In announcing that 45.3 overs remained to be bowled when play started again, the umpires also said tea would be taken an hour after the scheduled break.
South Africa have a 2-0 winning lead in the series.
